attributes.action: Stop a new needless bus lane in Caerphilly Rd involving tree felling.
attributes.background: Cardiff City Council is wanting to put bus lanes in places where they would be of little benefit and where there is no room for them. They will be removing huge trees which give character to a road, improve drainage and air quality and look wonderful all year round. In particular Caerphilly Rd A469.

rejection.details:
We can't accept your petition because the UK Government and Parliament aren't responsible for the issue you raise. The designation of bus lanes is the responsibility of your local council.

You could raise your issue with a local councillor, who represents you. You can use this page to find out who your local councillors are, and how to contact them:

https://www.gov.uk/find-your-local-councillor

Your local council also has a petitions process - you can find out more by contacting the council:
https://www.cardiff.gov.uk/ENG/Home/Contact-us/Pages/default.aspx
